messages.message:
hi team

In Build & Converse, when i have for example 2 tabs open (1 build, 1 converse) and i work in 1 tab, when i wait few mins and switch tab, the window always reloads.
Is that on purpose?

@Raul Mächler Are you using chrome? Recently Chrome introduced this feature where they offload idle tabs to optimize RAM usage, and reload them when you click on it! Can you pls verify if this is what is happening here?

no, i am in Firefox.
for all other tabs, this doesnt happen
@Raul Mächler is it happening for both Build and Converse or only Converse? cc: @Aayush

Hey Raul, this is intentional. We added global query refetching after a window is refocussed (after a certain time) to make sure the data is latest.
Are you facing issue because of this?

I do agree this doesn't make too much sense for converse because the data isn't updated in the background. It isn't the best UX to wait for a loading spinner for a while after you switch back to a tab - this also resets the state sometimes.
cc @Jessica what do you think about not having the global refetching for window refocus. I personally too have not been a fan of this behaviour - I use a multiple tabs a lot and getting a spinner before I can do anything isn't great. Also I think reloading to get fresh data is familiar by most users.
We can probably increase the stale time to begin with, I think the current stale time is 5 mins.
hmm, no issues. its just a little weird while demoing to customer. but i just wanted to know if its on purpose, thanks

I think the issue is that converse specifically checks for both isLoading and isFetching to show the spinner. We should take out the isFetching part. The global refetching on window refocus (which will happen if the data has not been reloaded in 5 minutes) is good because it makes sure that you’re not seeing out of date data.
I think these days users expect to see up to date data rather than having to refresh.
Makes sense, will check if removing the isFetching will hide the spinner
